noun.description: A genus of Gram-negative aerobic bacteria (family Nitrobacteraceae) whose members have the ability to oxidize ammonia to nitrite, and are found in soil and water; (also nitrosomonas) a bacterium of this genus (rare).

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in The Botanical Gazette. From scientific Latin Nitrosomonas from nitroso- + monas.
